description: Omnicom Group and French rival Publicis Groupe had been working to resolve roadblocks since the merger was announced in July.
title: Omnicom, Publicis Call Off Proposed $35 Billion Merger
title_page: Omnicom, Publicis Call Off Proposed $35 Billion Merger
text:
The companies had been working to resolve roadblocks in the deal after disagreements over terms, including who would be the chief financial officer of the combined company.
John Wren, the head of New York-based Omnicom, and Maurice Levy, his opposite at Paris-based Publicis, have been trying to settle the CFO choice, which had fueled tensions between the two sides even as they sought regulatory approvals for the blockbuster deal.
The merger called for a 50-50 ownership split of the equity in the new company, Publicis Omnicom Group, with Wren and Levy serving as co-CEOs for 30 months from the closing.
Omnicom and Publicis did not immediately respond to phone calls seeking comment.
-Reuters
